userreviews.userReview: Space gypsies and space Sesame Street in this book in the series of life-on-a-crazy-space-station. Also, some evil robots and an orphan alien princess. As usual, all tropes delightfully inverted.

SUPER enjoying this series. Very easy to read and absorbing. The kids are adorable and funny! Actually, quite like the time skip, which is surprising, since I usually don't. But the author writes it quite well and it just seems natural.
A bit of a disappointment after book #5 IMHO. Last chapter humor redemed it enough for me to give more than one star. Still prefer the consistance of Scalzi over Foner.

Another fun EarthCent story by Foner. I find it fascinating that in focusing on small group of people who are really trying to just survive and help one another Foner is able to continually utilize and develop engaging characters that the reader just enjoys. I think the reason I enjoy his books because the underlying mystery behind them is that of how the universe works, which is a concept anyone can connect with. The characters are humans who are trying to make their way (and find their place) amongst a galactic ecosystem that has been going on for thousands (or hundreds of thousands!) of years.If you've never read any of the EarthCent stories, start with the first book (Date Night on Union Station). But if you have enjoyed any of them, this is another fun continuation of the ongoing saga of the zany but likeable family of characters.

Read this one while on a weekend trip. It is yet another great book in this series. I've read six of them this year, and will continue for sure. They are just fun books—slices of life in a sci-fi world. They are clean, not-at-all violent and just interesting as all get out. Foner does such a great with characterization that you really care what happens with these people and wonder what they will experience next.
Fun, lighthearted series This series doesn’t take itself too seriously, and I love that! The characters are fun and engaging, and I love learning more about the different races on the station.
Not much plot to this one. The most entertaining parts are the TV shows.
Enjoyable
I really like the world building in the later Union Station books. The series started out really simple and every books keeps expanding the universe.
This book is really something else.A light funny world, with a series of wonderful characters, funny situations and a perfect balance of storyline and humor.
Pleasant fluff. Better than spending time watching TV situation comedies.

#6. More TroubleThis series continues to be a blast. Ambassador Kelly starts a quiz show to promote understanding between alien species and to help human relationships between them all. This does not work out as expected after the show's producers make a few changes. Also a multi-alien group shows up called the Wanderers and basically extorts repairs and money from the various alien governments, threatening to visit their home planets if aid isn't extended. There is also a look into the mind of Beowulf, the reincarnated Huravian Dog, who is becoming quite a character in this series. In fact a lot of new background information is presented concerning the Makers, Styrx and others. Start with the first book and read in order. You might as well get them all, they are original and worth it.

The family is growingThe third generation of humans are being born on Union Station. They're still the new kids on the block so to speak, but they're making friends and a place for themselves. Technically they may never catch up with the other aliens, but their naivete and honesty amuses the others who feel deception is better than war and 'fixing' anything from votes to contests is perfectly honorable. Besides the Stryx never let things go to far. Also in this book we find out why the Makers made the Stryx.

This entire series is brilliant, but this installment takes the madcap madness to a whole new level! A vagabond troupe of freeloading hedonists descend on the station, striking terror in the hearts of the experienced diplomats. The children of Union Station are the ones who learn what living like a bum entails, a challenge for them as they grew up under Styx tutelage and mastered not only barter, but empire-building in their childhoods! Ambassador Kelly might have been worried except the kids can handle themselves and she's got her own problems with a fledgling career in game shows!

Wandering why/ Wanderers was a nice little tale to fit in a lot of background information on the A.I. Stroud from their maker ,who is being interviewed by Kelly ,the Earth ambassador. The wanderers bring a little newness to the station, with some new characters added. There is a new little girl character that needs some help and her storyline starts in this tale that I would like to see additions too. In all this is another good story to keep greatly entertained.

Love the wanderer concept... just as I loved the Free Gem in the last book in this series. This is the 6th book I've read in this series in the past three months. The characters are delightfully engaging ! I look forward to the next installment.

Excellent as always!Great world building and even better characters. Do not start with this book. Go back and read the full set. Third reading of this series made me love it even more. Charming characters are usually never part of a science fiction novel. This has it all.

Worth the timeThe series continues to grow and improve. This time we are dealing with a group that is made of the freeloaders and ne'er do wells of multiple species. There is also another AI that is making troubling deals outside Stryx space. Very creative.
Series getting funnier.As I keep reading this series its gets funnier and can't stop laughing and wanting to read faster. A fan.
Not as good as its predecessors.
They flowThe story's flow together seamlessly. The characters are very likeable! These books are well worth reading. Just the right amount of humor ! Love these book
WanderersGood story. A visit from the wanderers, a visit from a hive AI and new TV shows. All the characters had their work cut out for them. Even Beowulf.
Lighthearted!Fun continuation on the ambassador series. Best to read the others first so you know who the many characters are. Great to see Kelly with a backbone too!

description: Book Six of EarthCent Ambassador. Start the series with the free Book One - Date Night on Union Station. Three years have passed, and the children are growing like weeds as Aisha grows into a new career. A mob of alien party animals has settled near Union Station like a plague, but nobody seems willing to see them off. They bring word of a new wave of helpful artificial intelligence, but perhaps there’s such a thing as too helpful?
title:
Wanderers On Union Station
      
          (EarthCent Ambassador #6)
